subject: Custom runner in a creation loop
msgSnippet: I m trying to adapt the custom filter runner posted by David Saff, but when I try to run a test the runner seems to be caught in an infinite instantiation
messageBody:
I'm trying to adapt the custom filter runner posted by David Saff, but when I
try to run a test the runner seems to be caught in an infinite instantiation
loop. (The behavior is the same whether I am running from ant 1.7 or
Eclipse 3.2) Here's a stripped-down example of the code that is causing
this to happen. What am I doing wrong?

tnx.

- Dani Zweig
dani@...

// The Runner:

package com.designadvance.test;

import org.junit.runner.Description;
import org.junit.runner.Request;
import org.junit.runner.Runner;
import org.junit.runner.notification.RunNotifier;

/**
* Trivial runner with console trace.
*/
public class VerboseRunner extends Runner {
private final Runner delegate;

public VerboseRunner(Class<?> testClass) throws Exception {
Request classRequest = Request.aClass(testClass);
delegate = classRequest.getRunner();
System.out.println("Created VerboseRunner with testClass " +
testClass);
}

@ Override
public Description getDescription() {
System.out.println("Description=" + delegate.getDescription());
return delegate.getDescription();
}

@ Override
public void run(RunNotifier notifier) {
System.out.println("Running...");
delegate.run(notifier);
}
}


// The Test


package com.designadvance.test;

import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;

import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;


/**
* Invoke JUnit4 with trivial customer runner.
*/
@ RunWith(VerboseRunner.class)
public class FilterTest2 {

public FilterTest2() {
// required
}

@Test
public void atest() {
int a = 1;
assertEquals(1, a);
}
@Test
public void btest1() {
int b = 2;
assertEquals(2, b);
}
@Test
public void btest2() {
int b = 1;
assertEquals(1, b);
}
}
